resources.string: In this app, the user can solve three different types of puzzles with different starting configurations. This app mainly serves to demonstrate the A* state-space search algorithm. Tap "Solve" at any point to have the app solve the problem and walk you through each step. Statistics on the solution are shown at the bottom.

A farmer and his wolf, goat, and cabbage come to the edge of a river they wish to cross. There is a boat at the rivers edge that only the farmer can row. The farmer can take at most one other object besides himself on a crossing, but if the wolf is ever left with the goat, the wolf will eat the goat; similarly, if the goat is left with the cabbage, the goat will eat the cabbage. Devise a sequence of crossings of the river so that all four characters arrive safely on the other side.

You are given a board in which numbered tiles can slide around. There is one blank space that holds not tile. A legal move consists of sliding a tile into the blank space if the tile is adjacent to it. The goal is to move tiles around until the board looks like the final state below.
